TestCase.Title: Test case EID_CLIENT_D_23
TestCase.Purpose: This test unit evaluates the possibility for the user to restrict the access rights requested by the eService (CHAT restriction) contained in OptionalCHAT.

Command.Text: Follow the Online-Authentication as described in until the access rights are displayed. In deviation to EID_CLIENT_B_01 also use the elements "AuthenticatedAuxiliaryData" and "OptionalCHAT" in DIDAuthenticateEAC1InputType.

TestStep.Description: The element "OptionalCHAT" contains the access rights only for [DGROUP_A] and [DGROUP_B].
The element "AuthenticatedAuxiliaryData" contains a valid date for the age verification.
The element "AuthenticatedAuxiliaryData" contains a valid date for the document validity check.
The element "AuthenticatedAuxiliaryData" contains a valid community ID.

ExpectedResult.Text: At least the access rights given in the OptionalCHAT element of the EAC1InputType are displayed.
The eID-Client has preselected all access rights given in the OptionalCHAT element of the EAC1InputType displayed in the user interface.
The eID-Client allows the user to deselect all displayed access rights granted by the eService certificate.
